edu.bsu.julia
Class ComplexNumber

java.lang.Object
  edu.bsu.julia.ComplexNumber

public class ComplexNumber
extends Object

Description

This class represents a complex number of the form x + bi where x and y are real numbers and i is the square root of -1.

Methods are provided for simple mathematical manipulation of complex numbers, as well as get methods.

Constructor Summary
ComplexNumber()
          The default constructor creates a new complex number of the form: 0 + 0 * i.
ComplexNumber(double xValue, double yValue)
          This constructor creates a complex number of the form: xValue + yValue * i.

setY

isZero

public boolean isZero()
Checks to see if this complex number is of the form 0 + 0 * i. The x and y values are doubles, so the checking this method does is highly inexact. It is meant solely for use in checking user input. Do not use on any complex number that has been mathematically changed in any way.

Returns:
A boolean indicating whether this complex number is 0 (true) or not (false).

squareRoot

public ComplexNumber[] squareRoot()
Computes the primary and secondary square root of a complex number.

Returns:
An array of size 2, with the primary root in position 0 and the secondary root in position 1.

cubeRoot

public ComplexNumber[] cubeRoot()
Computes the primary, secondary and tertiary roots of a complex number.

Returns:
An array of size 3, with the primary root in position 0, the secondary root in position 1, and the tertiary root in position 2.

polarConvertion

public ComplexNumber polarConvertion(ComplexNumber a)

toString

public String toString()
Provides a string representation of the complex number in the form: "{x, y}". "Computerized Scientific Notation" (the E form) is replaced with standard scientific notation.

toString in class Object
